metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6797 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The ResourceLinkFactory implementation in Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to9.0.0.M9, 8.5.0 to 8.5.4, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.36, 7.0.0 to 7.0.70 and 6.0.0 to6.0.45 did not limit web application access to global JNDI resources tothose resources explicitly linked to the web application. Therefore, it waspossible for a web application to access any global JNDI resource whetheran explicit ResourceLink had been configured or not.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6797` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.45+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3').
tomcat6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.45+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1').
tomcat8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3').
